questions.question: 1. After detection, how are protein bands typically quantified in Western blotting??
2. If the primary antibody is an unmodified mouse monoclonal antibody, then the secondary antibody must be

answers.a: anti-mouse IgG secondary antibody raised in horse
answers.b: anti-chicken IgG secondary antibody raised in mouse
answers.c: anti-goat IgG secondary antibody raised in horse
answers.d: anti-horse IgG secondary antibody raised in mouse

questions.question: 3. Which of the following is NOT an application of Western Blotting?
4. The primary antibody in a Western blot is used to

answers.b: Bind specifically to the target protein
answers.c: Transfer proteins from the gel to the membrane
answers.d: Visualize the separated proteins on the gel

questions.question: 5. What is the purpose of the transfer buffer in Western blotting?

answers.a: To separate proteins in the gel
answers.b: To facilitate the transfer of proteins from the gel to the membrane

questions.question: 6. Which washing buffer is commonly used in Western blotting to remove unbound antibodies?
7. Which step is essential for ensuring proteins are transferred efficiently from the gel to the membrane in Western blotting?

answers.b: Properly equilibrating the gel and membrane in transfer buffer
answers.c: Staining the gel with Coomassie blue
answers.d: Incubating the membrane overnight at room temperature

questions.question: 8. Why is it important to run a molecular weight marker alongside the samples in Western blotting?

answers.b: To determine the size of the separated proteins
answers.d: To increase the sensitivity of the assay

questions.question: 9. What is the primary purpose of the blotting step in Western blotting?

answers.a: To separate proteins based on their size
answers.b: To transfer proteins from the gel to a membrane

questions.question: 10. What is the role of the secondary antibody in Western blotting?

answers.a: To bind directly to the target protein
answers.b: To recognize and bind to the primary antibody
answers.c: To transfer proteins to the membrane
answers.d: To stain the proteins for visualization
